I needed an extension that quickly places the focus in the first input field. A couple of default shortcuts do it in all contexts I've tested: 'gg' to scroll to top, followed by 'gi' to focus on input. Disabling/enabling mappings is remarkably simple; so that to start with I'm just using a few scrolling shortcuts together with the find-in-page shortcuts.
I've even found out that you can suffix a search string with '\r' to launch a regex search. This is really great!

my keyoard remap idea shared here below:
map a LinkHints.activateMode
map ; LinkHints.activateMode
map gk goPrevious
map gd goPrevious
map gj goNext
map gd goNext
map . removeTab
map x removeTab
map f scrollDown
map d scrollUp
map <backspace> goBack
map gn goBack
map <tab> goForward
map gp goForward
map s scrollLeft

Problem of the focus lost inside of a text field or a flash application can be solved with AutoHotKey (Win).

It probably can be done better, but that's how I did it:

!n::
  MouseGetPos, xpos, ypos
  MouseMove 13, 110
  Send {Click}
  MouseMove xpos, ypos
  return

Which makes pressing Alt+n regain focus.
